metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10318 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A missing authorization check in the fscrypt_process_policy function in fs/crypto/policy.c in the ext4 and f2fs filesystem encryption support in the Linux kernel before 4.7.4 allows a user to assign an encryption policy to a directory owned by a different user, potentially creating a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-47-generic - 4.4.0-47.68
linux-image-4.4.0-47-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-47.68
linux-image-4.4.0-47-lowlatency - 4.4.0-47.68
linux-image-4.4.0-47-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-47.68
linux-image-4.4.0-47-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-47.68
linux-image-4.4.0-47-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-47.68
linux-image-4.4.0-47-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-47.68
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-47-generic - 4.4.0-47.68
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-47.68').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1038.45').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-47.68').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1035.39').
